When he was appointed the top antitrust cop at the Justice Department, Joel Klein was sharply criticized for being too soft, particularly on telecommunications mergers.
''We've got an antitrust fellow here who rolls over and plays dead,'' Senator Ernest Hollings said at the time.

Mr. Klein has now announced his intention to resign, after compiling a formidable prosecutorial record that included the order to break up the Microsoft Corporation, the dissolution of a global vitamin cartel and the compilation of a list of proposed corporate mergers that were abandoned or restructured after the government's antitrust objections.
